variables.desc: The Mega Drive, known as the Genesis in North America, is a 16-bit fourth-generation home video game console developed and marketed by Sega. It was Sega's third home console and the successor to the Master System. The Mega Drive was a key player in the fourth generation of video game consoles, competing with the Super Nintendo Entertainment System. It was known for its fast-paced action games and arcade ports.
